Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS FRUIT OIL
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Maintains the skin in good condition

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS GUM
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Produces a continuous film on skin, hair and / or nails
Belongs to the following substance group:
Fragrances or mixtures of fragrances are often referred to in the cosmetics area as "perfuming agents" or "perfume oils" or "parfum oils". On the cosmetic products they are declared with the INCI name "PARFUM". These are undiluted individual substances or their mixtures which originate from natural raw materials or can be produced (semi-) synthetically. They are starting materials for the production of perfume, eau de parfum, eau de toilette, eau de cologne and other perfumed cosmetic products. The average content of fragrances amounts in perfume to 15-30 %, in eau de parfum to 10-14 %, in eau de toilette to 6-9 %, in eau de cologne to 3-5 % as well as in skin creams, shampoos, hair and deodorant sprays to approximately 0.2-1 % and approximately 1-3 in deodorant sticks.

The perfume oils include essential oils, resinoids and absolutes. The sources are, amongst others, flowers, leaves and stems, fruits and fruit peels or roots of plants; woods, grasses or herbs, needles, resins and balsams. Moreover, only compounds isolated from natural products such as aldehydes, ketones, esters, alcohols etc. are used (geraniol, citronellal, citral, eugenol, menthol) as well as semi-synthetic (citronellol, geranyl acetate, jonone) and synthetic scents (eg phenylethyl alcohol and linalool) are used. Scents of animal origin such as musk and ambra are only rarely used.
Background information on use in cosmeti: Enhances the smell of a product and / or perfumes the skin

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS GUM OIL
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Prevents seborrhea and / or seborrheic dermatitis or relieves their symptoms; and / or acts against dandruff
Belongs to the following substance group: Part of perfume oils and / or flavours
Background information on use in cosmeti: Helps control the growth of micro-organisms (eg bacteria and fungi)

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS GUM WATER
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Prevents seborrhea and / or seborrheic dermatitis or relieves their symptoms; and / or acts against dandruff
Belongs to the following substance group: Part of perfume oils and / or flavours
Background information on use in cosmeti: Helps control the growth of micro-organisms (eg bacteria and fungi)

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS LEAF CERA
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Protects the skin from external influences
Origin: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetic products

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS LEAF WAX
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: The function of this ingredient in cosmetic products has not yet been further specified

Name: PISTACIA LENTISCUS SEED OIL
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Helps control the growth of micro-organisms (eg bacteria and fungi)
Background information on use in cosmeti: Vegetable oils are characterised by a high share of (poly) unsaturated fatty acids, which are characteristic for the liquid consistency. As an admixture many vitamins, carotenoids and free fatty acids are present.

Name: PISTACIA VERA SEED EXTRACT
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Leaves the hair easy to comb, supple, soft and shiny and / or imparts volume
Origin: Maintains the skin in good condition

Name: PISTACIA VERA SEED OIL
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Maintains the skin in good condition

Name: PISTACIA VERA SHELL POWDER
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Removes dental plaque or dirt from the skin surface through a grinding / polishing effect

Name: BACILLUS/MONASCUS/PISTACIA VERA FRUIT/SOYBEAN FERMENT FILTRATE
Type of preparation:
Bacteria of the genus bacillus are used for fermentation

Fungi of the genus monascus are used for fermentation

Fermented (converted) together with soy beans (glycine soya) or soya milk

Fermentation product (converted with enzymes, (yeast-) fungi or bacteria), filtrate
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Helps control the growth of micro-organisms (eg bacteria and fungi)
Origin: Inhibits reactions promoted by oxygen, thus avoiding oxidation and deterioration of ingredients
Belongs to the following substance group: Leaves the hair easy to comb, supple, soft and shiny and / or imparts volume

Name: HYDROGENATED PISTACIA VERA SEED OIL
Type of preparation:
Hydrogenated means: treated with hydrogen (hydrogenated)

Fat or essential oil
Function(s) of this ingredient in cosmet: Maintains the skin in good condition
